titleStmt.title: The royall oak: or, The wonderfull travels, miraculous escapes, strange accidents of his sacred majesty King Charles the second. How from Worcester fight by a good hap, our royall king made an escape ... To the tune of, In my freedom is all my joy.
titleStmt.author: Wade, John, fl. 1660-1680.

notesStmt.note: Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Right half-sheet contains: The second part, to the same tune.
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
